meanings.def: of the poorest quality or lowest standard; worse than any other person or thing of a similar kind
examples: It was by far the worst speech he had ever made.
It's not the worst idea I've ever heard.
What's the worst thing that could happen?
What she said confirmed my worst fears (= proved they were right).
This is every parent's worst nightmare.

meanings.def: to be the cause of your own problems
examples: Her indecisiveness makes her her own worst enemy.
Some dancers become their own worst enemies, criticizing themselves for every imperfection.

meanings.def: to lose a fight, competition, etc. or suffer more compared with others

idioms.def: to be the cause of your own problems
examples: Her indecisiveness makes her her own worst enemy.
Some dancers become their own worst enemies, criticizing themselves for every imperfection.

idioms.def: to lose a fight, competition, etc. or suffer more compared with others

related: if the worst comes to the worst
bring out the worst in somebody
the best/worst of all possible worlds
be in bad, poor, the worst possible, etc. taste

examples: He was voted the worst dressed celebrity.
Manufacturing industry was worst affected by the fuel shortage.
Singapore has been among the countries worst hit by the virus.
The report depicts British teenagers as the worst behaved in Europe.
Worst of all, I lost the watch my father had given me.

meanings.def: the most serious or unpleasant thing that could happen; the part, situation, possibility, etc. that is worse than any other
examples: When they did not hear from her, they feared the worst.
It doesn't matter what I say. My mother always expects the worst.
the worst of something The worst of it is that I can't even be sure if they received my letter.
Although all the votes have not yet been counted, the party is preparing for the worst.
This is politics at its worst.
If the worst happens, at least you're prepared.
The worst of the storm was over.
He was always optimistic, even when things were at their worst.
At its worst, bullying is a kind of torture.
Don't worry—the worst that can happen is that you'll get a fine.
He was still very ill, but the worst seemed to be over.
Her sister helped her through the worst of her illness.
I had not expected to do well in my exams, and the letter confirmed the worst.
Scotland seemed to have escaped the worst of the recession.
She always thinks the worst of people.

meanings.def: used for saying what is the worst thing that can happen
examples: At the very worst, he'll have to pay a fine.
At worst this may mean the end of her playing career.
At worst, the drug can be fatal.

meanings.def: to make somebody show their worst qualities
examples: Pressure can bring out the worst in people.
Christmas usually brings out the absolute worst in sentimental platitudes.

meanings.def: to do as much damage or be as unpleasant as possible
examples: Let them do their worst—we'll fight them every inch of the way.
He'd been in a fight and had obviously got the worst of it.

meanings.def: if the situation becomes too difficult or dangerous
examples: If the worst comes to the worst, we'll just have to sell the house.

meanings.def: a situation in which you have all the possible disadvantages at the same time

examples: be worsted (by somebody) (in something) She couldn't bear to be worsted in a fight.
